list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a cunning or skillful act or scheme intended to deceive or outwit someone.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: he's a double-dealer capable of any mean trick
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: anh ấy là một đại lý kép có khả năng bất kỳ mánh khóe nào

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a peculiar or characteristic habit or mannerism.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: she had a trick of clipping off certain words and phrases
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Cô có một mẹo cắt bỏ những từ và cụm từ nhất định

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: (in bridge, whist, and similar card games) a sequence of cards forming a single round of play. One card is laid down by each player, the highest card being the winner.
a sailor's turn at the helm, usually lasting for two or four hours.
deceive or outwit (someone) by being cunning or skillful.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: buyers can be tricked by savvy sellers
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Người mua có thể bị lừa bởi người bán Savvy

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: sketch (a coat of arms) in outline, with the colors indicated by letters or signs.
intended or used to deceive or mystify, or to create an illusion.
